body: Yeah, I'd be happy with that.
With https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/30312 being merged, at least this should state something more than `os error` in Rust 1.7, which is an improvement...

I'm getting conflicting messages from this thread. If the problem is that `os error` isn't useful, that's coming from `fmt` of a _non-hyper_ IO error. So handing off error formatting of non-hyper errors (such as `IO`) to `fmt` wouldn't actually address the initial example. Right?

@xaviershay the problem is that a `Display` impl is calling `description` on the std error instead of `Display::fmt`, so no useful information is propagated, even though it's accessible from the std error.

@xaviershay it's because the `description` of `io::Error` before Rust 1.7 simply says "os error". Instead of printing the description, we could print the full `fmt::Debug` message of `io::Error` (or, in 1.7, the description will match the Debug output anyways).

Hey all, I am a little confused on this issue. @seanmonstar, did your PR [rust-lang/rust#30312](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/30312) resolve the matter or am I not quite understanding? Apologies, I'm still getting used to Rust and would like to help if I can.
@josephpd3 I'm sure that PR improved things. We could make it a little better in hyper by doing as I suggest in the [2nd comment](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/694#issuecomment-159021620).

issue.title: Display impl for Error shows better information
issue.body:
Displays the inner error for Error types with inner errors instead of just displaying the description.

References #694
